ci_support_linux_64_python3.10.____cpyth:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler_version
  - cxx_compiler_version

about.description:
UDPipe is a trainable pipeline for tokenization, tagging, lemmatization and
dependency parsing of CoNLL-U files. UDPipe is language-agnostic and can be
trained given annotated data in CoNLL-U format. Trained models are provided
for nearly all UD treebanks. UDPipe is available as a binary for Linux/Windows/OS X,
as a library for C++, Python, Perl, Java, C#, and as a web service. Third-party
R CRAN package also exists.
about.summary: UDPipe is a trainable pipeline for tokenization, tagging, lemmatization and dependency parsing of CoNLL-U files.

name: ufal.udpipe

about.description:
UDPipe is a trainable pipeline for tokenization, tagging, lemmatization and
dependency parsing of CoNLL-U files. UDPipe is language-agnostic and can be
trained given annotated data in CoNLL-U format. Trained models are provided
for nearly all UD treebanks. UDPipe is available as a binary for Linux/Windows/OS X,
as a library for C++, Python, Perl, Java, C#, and as a web service. Third-party
R CRAN package also exists.
about.summary: UDPipe is a trainable pipeline for tokenization, tagging, lemmatization and dependency parsing of CoNLL-U files.

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "ufal.udpipe" %}
{% set version = "1.4.0.1" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/ufal_udpipe-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 42b3c19888f3228ffb6d91c0991c949e378c5dafecc12008c089a1f4182357d7

build:
  number: 1
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps --ignore-installed --no-cache-dir -vvv
  skip: true  # [win and vc<14]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
  host:
    - python
    - pip
    - setuptools
  run:
    - python

test:
  imports:
    - ufal.udpipe

about:
  home: http://ufal.mff.cuni.cz/udpipe
  license: MPL-2.0
  license_family: OTHER
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: UDPipe is a trainable pipeline for tokenization, tagging, lemmatization and dependency parsing of CoNLL-U files.
  description: |
    UDPipe is a trainable pipeline for tokenization, tagging, lemmatization and
    dependency parsing of CoNLL-U files. UDPipe is language-agnostic and can be
    trained given annotated data in CoNLL-U format. Trained models are provided
    for nearly all UD treebanks. UDPipe is available as a binary for Linux/Windows/OS X,
    as a library for C++, Python, Perl, Java, C#, and as a web service. Third-party
    R CRAN package also exists.
  doc_url: http://ufal.mff.cuni.cz/udpipe/users-manual
  dev_url: https://github.com/ufal/udpipe

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - ajdapretnar
    - primozgodec
    - astaric

about.description:
UDPipe is a trainable pipeline for tokenization, tagging, lemmatization and
dependency parsing of CoNLL-U files. UDPipe is language-agnostic and can be
trained given annotated data in CoNLL-U format. Trained models are provided
for nearly all UD treebanks. UDPipe is available as a binary for Linux/Windows/OS X,
as a library for C++, Python, Perl, Java, C#, and as a web service. Third-party
R CRAN package also exists.
about.summary: UDPipe is a trainable pipeline for tokenization, tagging, lemmatization and dependency parsing of CoNLL-U files.
